algorithms.name: Gamepad/connected
algorithms.html: The connected getter steps are:

steps.html: Return this.[[connected]].

algorithms.name: Gamepad/timestamp
algorithms.html: The timestamp getter steps are:

steps.html: Return this.[[timestamp]].

algorithms.name: selecting a mapping
algorithms.html:
To <dfn data-lt="selecting a mapping|select a mapping" id="dfn-selecting-a-mapping" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">select a mapping</dfn> for a
            gamepad device, run the following steps:

steps.html: If the button and axis layout of the gamepad device corresponds with the Standard Gamepad layout, then return "standard".
Return "".

algorithms.html: The axes getter steps are:

steps.html: Return this.[[axes]].

algorithms.html: The buttons getter steps are:

steps.html: Return this.[[buttons]].

algorithms.html: The touches getter steps are:

steps.html: Return this.[[touches]].

algorithms.name: Gamepad/vibrationActuator
algorithms.html: The vibrationActuator getter steps are:

steps.html: Return this.[[vibrationActuator]].

algorithms.name: receives new button or axis input values
algorithms.html:
When the system <dfn id="dfn-receives-new-button-or-axis-input-values" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">receives new button or axis input values</dfn>,
          run the following steps:

steps.html: Let gamepad be the Gamepad object representing the device that received new button or axis input values.
Queue a global task on the gamepad task source with gamepad's relevant global object to update gamepad state for gamepad.

algorithms.name: update gamepad state
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-update-gamepad-state" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">update gamepad state</dfn> for <var data-type="Gamepad">gamepad</var>, run the
          following steps:

steps.html: Let now be the current high resolution time given gamepad's relevant global object.
Set gamepad.[[timestamp]] to now.
Run the steps to map and normalize axes for gamepad.
Run the steps to map and normalize buttons for gamepad.
Run the steps to record touches for gamepad.
Let navigator be gamepad's relevant global object's Navigator object.
If navigator.[[hasGamepadGesture]] is false and gamepad contains a gamepad user gesture:
Set navigator.[[hasGamepadGesture]] to true.
For each connectedGamepad of navigator.[[gamepads]]:
If connectedGamepad is not equal to null:
Set connectedGamepad.[[exposed]] to true.
Set connectedGamepad.[[timestamp]] to now.
Let document be gamepad's relevant global object's associated Document; otherwise null.

If document is not null and is fully active, then queue a global task on the gamepad task source to fire an event named gamepadconnected at gamepad's relevant global object using GamepadEvent with its gamepad attribute initialized to connectedGamepad.

algorithms.name: map and normalize axes
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-map-and-normalize-axes" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">map and normalize axes</dfn> for <var data-type="Gamepad">gamepad</var>, run the
          following steps:

steps.html: Let axisValues be a list of unsigned long values representing the most recent logical axis input values for each axis input of the device represented by gamepad.
Let maxRawAxisIndex be the size of axisValues − 1.
For each rawAxisIndex of the range from 0 to maxRawAxisIndex:
Let mappedIndex be gamepad.[[axisMapping]][rawAxisIndex].

Let <var data-type="unsigned long">logicalValue</var> be
              <var data-type="list">axisValues</var>[<var data-type="long">rawAxisIndex</var>].
Let logicalMinimum be gamepad.[[axisMinimums]][rawAxisIndex].
Let logicalMaximum be gamepad.[[axisMaximums]][rawAxisIndex].

Let <var data-type="double">normalizedValue</var> be 2 (<var data-type="unsigned long">logicalValue</var> −
              <var data-type="unsigned long">logicalMinimum</var>) / (<var data-type="unsigned long">logicalMaximum</var> − <var data-type="unsigned long">logicalMinimum</var>) − 1.
Set gamepad.[[axes]][axisIndex] to be normalizedValue.

algorithms.name: map and normalize buttons
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-map-and-normalize-buttons" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">map and normalize buttons</dfn> for <var data-type="Gamepad">gamepad</var>, run
          the following steps:

steps.html: Let buttonValues be a list of unsigned long values representing the most recent logical button input values for each button input of the device represented by gamepad.
Let maxRawButtonIndex be the size of buttonValues − 1.
For each rawButtonIndex of the range from 0 to maxRawButtonIndex:
Let mappedIndex be gamepad.[[buttonMapping]][rawButtonIndex].

Let <var data-type="unsigned long">logicalValue</var> be
              <var data-type="list">buttonValues</var>[<var data-type="long">rawButtonIndex</var>].
Let logicalMinimum be gamepad.[[buttonMinimums]][rawButtonIndex].
Let logicalMaximum be gamepad.[[buttonMaximums]][rawButtonIndex].

Let <var data-type="double">normalizedValue</var> be (<var data-type="unsigned long">logicalValue</var> −
              <var data-type="unsigned long">logicalMinimum</var>) / (<var data-type="unsigned long">logicalMaximum</var> − <var data-type="unsigned long">logicalMinimum</var>).
Let button be gamepad.[[buttons]][mappedIndex].
Set button.[[value]] to normalizedValue.

If the button has a digital switch to indicate a pure pressed or released state, set button.[[pressed]] to true if the button is pressed or false if it is not pressed.

Otherwise, set button.[[pressed]] to true if the value is above the button press threshold or false if it is not above the threshold.

If the button is capable of detecting touch, set button.[[touched]] to true if the button is currently being touched.

Otherwise, set button.[[touched]] to button.[[pressed]].

algorithms.name: record touches
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-record-touches" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">record touches</dfn> for <var data-type="Gamepad">gamepad</var>, run the following
          steps:

steps.html: Assert: Gamepad.[[touches]] is empty.

Repeat the following steps for each touch surface on <var data-type="Gamepad">gamepad</var> in
          touch surface enumeration order:

Let <var data-type="unsigned long">surfaceId</var> be the current surface
              enumeration index.

If the touch surface exposes maximum surface dimensions in device units, then set touch.surfaceDimensions to a DOMRectReadOnly with width and height initialized to the maximum X and Y dimensions on the touch surface in device units.

Repeat the following steps for each active touch point
              reported by the <var data-type="Gamepad">gamepad</var> for the current touch surface.
Let touch be a newly created GamepadTouch object.
Set touch.surfaceId to be surfaceId.
If the touch data is part of an existing active touch point tracked by the user agent:
Set touch.touchId to the touchId of the active touch point.
Otherwise, set touch.touchId to gamepad.[[nextTouchId]] and increment gamepad.[[nextTouchId]].

Set touch.position to a new DOMPointReadOnly with x initialized to device X coordinate relative to the device touch surface and normalized to [-1 .. 1] where -1 is the leftmost coordinate and 1 is the rightmost coordinate and y initialized to the device touch surface and normalized to [-1 .. 1] where -1 is the topmost coordinate and 1 is the bottommost coordinate.
Append touch to gamepad.[[touches]].

algorithms.name: A new Gamepad
algorithms.html: A new Gamepad representing a connected gamepad device is constructed by performing the following steps:

steps.html: Let gamepad be a newly created Gamepad instance:
Initialize gamepad's id attribute to an identification string for the gamepad.
Initialize gamepad's index attribute to the result of selecting an unused gamepad index for gamepad.
Initialize gamepad's mapping attribute to the result of selecting a mapping for the gamepad device.
Set gamepad.[[connected]] to true.
Set gamepad.[[timestamp]] to the current high resolution time given gamepad's relevant global object.
Set gamepad.[[axes]] to the result of initializing axes for gamepad.
Set gamepad.[[buttons]] to the result of initializing buttons for gamepad.
Set gamepad.[[vibrationActuator]] to the result of constructing a GamepadHapticActuator for gamepad.
Return <var data-type="Gamepad">gamepad</var>.

algorithms.name: selecting an unused gamepad index
algorithms.html:
To <dfn data-lt="selecting an unused gamepad index|select an unused gamepad index" id="dfn-selecting-an-unused-gamepad-index" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">select an unused
          gamepad index</dfn> for <var data-type="Gamepad">gamepad</var>, run the following steps:

steps.html: Let navigator be gamepad's relevant global object's Navigator object.
Let maxGamepadIndex be the size of navigator.[[gamepads]] − 1.
For each gamepadIndex of the range from 0 to maxGamepadIndex:
If navigator.[[gamepads]][gamepadIndex] is null, then return gamepadIndex.
Append null to navigator.[[gamepads]].
Return the size of navigator.[[gamepads]] − 1.

algorithms.name: initializing axes
algorithms.html:
To <dfn data-lt="initializing axes|initialize axes" id="dfn-initializing-axes" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">initialize axes</dfn> for
          <var data-type="Gamepad">gamepad</var>, run the following steps:

steps.html:
Let <var data-type="long">inputCount</var> be the number of axis inputs exposed by the
          device represented by <var data-type="Gamepad">gamepad</var>.
Set gamepad.[[axisMinimums]] to a list of unsigned long values with size equal to inputCount containing minimum logical values for each of the axis inputs.
Set gamepad.[[axisMaximums]] to a list of unsigned long values with size equal to inputCount containing maximum logical values for each of the axis inputs.
Let unmappedInputList be an empty list.
Let mappedIndexList be an empty list.
Let <var data-type="long">axesSize</var> be 0.
For each rawInputIndex of the range from 0 to inputCount − 1:
If the gamepad axis at index rawInputIndex represents a Standard Gamepad axis:
Let canonicalIndex be the canonical index for the axis.
Otherwise:
Set gamepad.[[axisMapping]][rawInputIndex] to canonicalIndex.
Append canonicalIndex to mappedIndexList.

If <var data-type="long">canonicalIndex</var> + 1 is greater than <var data-type="long">axesSize</var>,
                      then set <var data-type="long">axesSize</var> to <var data-type="long">canonicalIndex</var> + 1.
Let <var data-type="long">axisIndex</var> be 0.
For each rawInputIndex of unmappedInputList:
While mappedIndexList contains axisIndex:
Increment <var data-type="long">axisIndex</var>.
Set gamepad.[[axisMapping]][rawInputIndex] to axisIndex.
Append axisIndex to mappedIndexList.

If <var data-type="long">axisIndex</var> + 1 is greater than <var data-type="long">axesSize</var>, then set
              <var data-type="long">axesSize</var> to <var data-type="long">axisIndex</var> + 1.
Let axes be an empty list.
For each axisIndex of the range from 0 to axesSize − 1, append 0 to axes.
Return <var>axes</var>.

algorithms.name: initializing buttons
algorithms.html:
To <dfn data-lt="initializing buttons|initialize buttons" id="dfn-initializing-buttons" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">initialize buttons</dfn> for
          <var data-type="Gamepad">gamepad</var>, run the following steps:

steps.html:
Let <var data-type="long">inputCount</var> be the number of button inputs exposed by
          the device represented by <var data-type="Gamepad">gamepad</var>.
Set gamepad.[[buttonMinimums]] to be a list of unsigned long values with size equal to inputCount containing minimum logical values for each of the button inputs.
Set gamepad.[[buttonMaximums]] to be a list of unsigned long values with size equal to inputCount containing maximum logical values for each of the button inputs.
Let unmappedInputList be an empty list.
Let mappedIndexList be an empty list.
Let <var data-type="long">buttonsSize</var> be 0.
For each rawInputIndex of the range from 0 to inputCount − 1:
If the gamepad button at index rawInputIndex represents a Standard Gamepad button:
Let canonicalIndex be the canonical index for the button.
Otherwise:
Set gamepad.[[buttonMapping]][rawInputIndex] to canonicalIndex.
Append canonicalIndex to mappedIndexList.

If <var data-type="long">canonicalIndex</var> + 1 is greater than
                      <var data-type="long">buttonsSize</var>, then set <var data-type="long">buttonsSize</var> to <var data-type="long">canonicalIndex</var>
                      + 1.
Increment <var data-type="long">rawInputIndex</var>.
Let <var data-type="long">buttonIndex</var> be 0.
For each rawInputIndex of unmappedInputList:
While mappedIndexList contains buttonIndex:
Increment <var data-type="long">buttonIndex</var>.
Set gamepad.[[buttonMapping]][rawInputIndex] to buttonIndex.
Append buttonIndex to mappedIndexList.

If <var data-type="long">buttonIndex</var> + 1 is greater than <var data-type="long">buttonsSize</var>, then set
              <var data-type="long">buttonsSize</var> to <var data-type="long">buttonIndex</var> + 1.
Let buttons be an empty list.
For each buttonIndex of the range from 0 to buttonsSize − 1, append a new GamepadButton to buttons.
Return <var>buttons</var>.

algorithms.name: GamepadButton/pressed
algorithms.html: The pressed getter steps are:

steps.html: Return this.[[pressed]].

algorithms.name: GamepadButton/touched
algorithms.html: The touched getter steps are:

steps.html: Return this.[[touched]].

algorithms.name: GamepadButton/value
algorithms.html: The value getter steps are:

steps.html: Return this.[[value]].

algorithms.name: GamepadHapticActuator/effects
algorithms.html: The effects getter steps are:

steps.html: Return this.[[effects]].

algorithms.name: GamepadHapticActuator/playEffect()
algorithms.html: The playEffect() method steps, called with GamepadHapticEffectType type and GamepadEffectParameters params, are:

steps.html: If params does not describe a valid effect of type type, return a promise rejected with a TypeError.
Let document be the current settings object's relevant global object's associated Document.
If document is null or document is not fully active or document's visibility state is "hidden", return a promise rejected with an "InvalidStateError" DOMException.
If this.[[playingEffectPromise]] is not null:
Let effectPromise be this.[[playingEffectPromise]].
Set this.[[playingEffectPromise]] to null.
Queue a global task on the gamepad task source with the relevant global object of this to resolve effectPromise with "preempted".
If this GamepadHapticActuator cannot play effects with type type, return a promise rejected with reason NotSupportedError.
Let [[playingEffectPromise]] be a new promise.
Let playEffectTimestamp be the current high resolution time given the document's relevant global object.
Do the following steps in parallel:
Issue a haptic effect to the actuator with type, params, and the playEffectTimestamp.
When the effect completes, if this.[[playingEffectPromise]] is not null, queue a global task on the gamepad task source with the relevant global object of this to run the following steps:
If this.[[playingEffectPromise]] is null, abort these steps.
Resolve this.[[playingEffectPromise]] with "complete".
Set this.[[playingEffectPromise]] to null.
Return [[playingEffectPromise]].

algorithms.name: GamepadHapticActuator/reset()
algorithms.html: The reset() method steps are:

steps.html: Let document be the current settings object's relevant global object's associated Document.
If document is null or document is not fully active or document's visibility state is "hidden", return a promise rejected with an "InvalidStateError" DOMException.
Let resetResultPromise be a new promise.
If this.[[playingEffectPromise]] is not null, do the following steps in parallel:
Let effectPromise be this.[[playingEffectPromise]].
Stop haptic effects on this's gamepad's actuator.
If the effect has been successfully stopped, do:
If effectPromise and this.[[playingEffectPromise]] are still the same, set this.[[playingEffectPromise]] to null.
Queue a global task on the gamepad task source with the relevant global object of this to resolve effectPromise with "preempted".
Resolve resetResultPromise with "complete"
Return <var data-type="Promise">resetResultPromise</var>.

algorithms.name: valid effect
algorithms.html: To check if an effect with GamepadHapticEffectType type and GamepadEffectParameters params describes a valid effect, run the following steps:

steps.html:
Given the value of GamepadHapticEffectType type, switch on:
"dual-rumble"
If params does not describe a valid dual-rumble effect, return false.
"trigger-rumble"
If params does not describe a valid trigger-rumble effect, return false.
Return true

algorithms.html: When the document's visibility state becomes "hidden", run these steps for each GamepadHapticActuator actuator:

steps.html: If actuator.[[playingEffectPromise]] is null, abort these steps.
Queue a global task on the gamepad task source with the relevant global object of actuator to run the following steps:
If actuator.[[playingEffectPromise]] is null, abort these steps.
Resolve actuator.[[playingEffectPromise]] with "preempted".
Set actuator.[[playingEffectPromise]] to null.
Stop haptic effects on actuator.

algorithms.name: constructing a GamepadHapticActuator
algorithms.html: A new gamepadHapticActuator representing a Gamepad's primary vibration actuator is constructed by performing the following steps:

steps.html: Let gamepadHapticActuator be a newly created GamepadHapticActuator instance.
Let supportedEffectsList be an empty list.
For each enum value type of GamepadHapticEffectType, if the user agent can send a command to initiate effects of that type on that actuator, append type to supportedEffectsList.
Set gamepadHapticActuator.[[effects]] to supportedEffectsList.

algorithms.html: The getGamepads() method steps are:

steps.html: Let doc be the current global object's associated Document.
If doc is null or doc is not fully active, then return an empty list.
If doc is not allowed to use the "gamepad" permission, then throw a "SecurityError" DOMException and abort these steps.
If this.[[hasGamepadGesture]] is false, then return an empty list.
Let now be the current high resolution time given the current global object.
Let gamepads be an empty list.
For each gamepad of this.[[gamepads]]:
If gamepad is not null and gamepad.[[exposed]] is false:
Set gamepad.[[exposed]] to true.
Set gamepad.[[timestamp]] to now.
Append gamepad to gamepads.
Return <var data-type="sequence<Gamepad?>">gamepads</var>.

algorithms.html:
When a gamepad becomes available on the system, run the following
        steps:

steps.html: Let document be the current global object's associated Document; otherwise null.
If document is not null and is not allowed to use the "gamepad" permission, then abort these steps.
Queue a global task on the gamepad task source with the current global object to perform the following steps:
Let gamepad be a new Gamepad representing the gamepad.
Let navigator be gamepad's relevant global object's Navigator object.
Set navigator.[[gamepads]][gamepad.index] to gamepad.
If navigator.[[hasGamepadGesture]] is true:
Set gamepad.[[exposed]] to true.
If document is not null and is fully active, then fire an event named gamepadconnected at gamepad's relevant global object using GamepadEvent with its gamepad attribute initialized to gamepad.

algorithms.html:
When a gamepad becomes unavailable on the system, run the following
        steps:

steps.html: Let gamepad be the Gamepad representing the unavailable device.
Queue a global task on the gamepad task source with gamepad's relevant global object to perform the following steps:
Set gamepad.[[connected]] to false.
Let document be gamepad's relevant global object's associated Document; otherwise null.

If gamepad.[[exposed]] is true and document is not null and is fully active, then fire an event named gamepaddisconnected at gamepad's relevant global object using GamepadEvent with its gamepad attribute initialized to gamepad.
Let navigator be gamepad's relevant global object's Navigator object.
Set navigator.[[gamepads]][gamepad.index] to null.
While navigator.[[gamepads]] is not empty and the last item of navigator.[[gamepads]] is null, remove the last item of navigator.[[gamepads]].
